intro: Scolymocephalus scaber, commonly known as the rough scolymus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its upright, branched stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in Mediterranean climates. Due to its unique morphology and habitat preferences, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
